alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 11:33AM EST until March 02 at 4:25PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Spencer. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River. .Multiple rounds of recent rainfall preceded by snow melt, along with the current system moving through with wintry precipitation, will keep minor flooding ongoing along the East Fork White, upper White and most of the Upper Wabash. Lower portions of the White and Wabash are expected to see moderate flooding, as expected precipitation amounts with the current system are highest over southern portions of central Indiana. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.9 feet, A 25 foot section of Levee Unit 8 failed at this level on March 6 2011...flooding local roads behind the levee. Flooding not nearly as bad as June 2008 levee failure. Flooding was very close to one of the June 2008 failures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Thursday /6:00 AM CST Thursday/ the stage was 21.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EST Thursday /6:00 AM CST Thursday/ was 21.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue falling to 11.3 feet Sunday, March 06. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1145 PM EST /1045 PM CST/.
